greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum (-1)^k where the sum is over all factorizations of n into factors > 1 and k is the number of factors.
comment: First term greater than 1 in absolute value is a(256) = 2.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
program: (PARI) A316441(n, m=n, k=0) = if(1==n, (-1)^k, my(s=0); fordiv(n, d, if((d>1)&&(d<=m), s += A316441(n/d, d, k+1))); (s)); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 08 2018, after _Michael B. Porter_'s code for A001055
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jul 03 2018
ext: Secondary offset added by _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 08 2018
